body.head: Die letzten fünf Sonaten von Beethoven ... op. 111

div.p: The third volume of Schenker's "Erläuterungsausgabe," published in 1916 and comprising Beethoven's Piano Sonata in C minor, Op. 111 in his edition based on the two autograph manuscripts and 61 pages of sketches (Artaria 201), his "Vorwort" (Foreword), "Vorbemerkung zur Einführung" (Preliminary Remark to the Introduction), "Einführung" (Introduction—Schenker also informally called this section "Analyse"), and "Literatur" (Secondary Literature). It is published by Universal Edition, Vienna.

div.head: First Edition
div.p: The original edition was published in 1916, with publication number UE 3978.
Cover title-page: BEETHOVEN-SCHENKER | ERLÄUTERUNGS-AUSGABE | DER LETZTEN FÜNF SONATEN | SONATE C MOLL | OP. 111.
Inner title-page: DIE LETZTEN | FÜNF SONATEN | VON | BEETHOVEN | — | KRITISCHE AUSGABE | MIT EINFÜHRUNG | UND ERLÄUTERUNG | VON | HEINRICH SCHENKER | — | PIANO SOLO

Chronology: Schenker's Foreword is dated August 30, 1915. He had submitted his manuscript of the work on May 4, 1915; proof correcting ran from July 1915 to early January 1916. The edition went to press on January 22, 1916, and 500 copies were delivered from the printer to the publisher on March 31, 1916.

div.head: Second Edition
div.p: Chronology: This edition went to press on April 25, 1925, and 497 copies were delivered from the printer to the publisher on August 25, 1925.

div.head: New Edition
div.p: Edited by Oswald Jonas, and published in 1971, with publication number UE 26.305, this excises Schenker's polemical matter and commentary on the secondary literature, and replaces Schenker's edition with the 1945 revision by Erwin Ratz.

div.head: English Translation
div.p: An English translation of all four volumes of the Erläuterungsausgabe by John Rothgeb is currently in progress (2010).
